result.execSummary:
The defendant Connie J Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Connie J Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Connie J Johnson in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:49 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Cousins does not object to the Court signing the Order for Early Discharge. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court signs the Order for Early Discharge pursuant to the statute.
from DOC recommendation for discharge w/unsigned order
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Connie J Johnson in court with attorney Edmund Jelinski. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:57 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  Moves to amend the charge from Felony to 3 Class A Misdemeanors 943.50(1m)(b).  Is not prepared with an amended information but can file one. 
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.  Makes additional statements.  Defendant's husband would like to make statements. 

BY THE COURT:  On motion of the state, the charge is ordered amended from felony retail theft to 3 counts of misdemeanor retail theft.
Atty Jelinski waives the reading of the amended charges. 

Defendant enters a plea of: Counts 1 thru 3 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1 thru 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

M. Johnson makes statements to the Court. 
Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Jelinski makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - 
Imposed and Stayed - 150 days in jail
Huber for going to work and getting counseling or any medical treatment. 
Placed on probation for a period of 18 months:
Not to have contact with Shopko. 
Pay fine of $200 plus costs and the DNA surcharge. To be paid during the period of probation on an arrangement made between the defendant and the agent. 
Maintain fulltime employment if able to do so.
Participate in any counseling as recommended by the agent. 

Count 2 -
Imposed and Stayed - 150 days in jail, concurrent with Count 1.
Huber for going to work and getting counseling or any medical treatment. 
Placed on probation for a period of 18 months, concurrent with Count 1:
Comply with conditions on Count 1. 
Pay costs and DNA surcharge. 

Count 3 - 
Imposed and Stayed - 150 days in jail, concurrent with Counts 1 & 2.
Huber for going to work and getting counseling or any medical treatment. 
Placed on probation for a period of 18 months:
Comply with conditions on Counts 1 & 2. 
Pay costs and DNA surcharge.
Pre-trial conference on April 6, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 2, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 12, 2015 at 11:00 am.
$1,500 sig bond: Not to be on the premises of Shopko in Plover or Stevens Point

Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
Defendant waives any conflict with co-defendant Mary Peterson as Atty Jeliniski represents both.

BTC:  $1,500 sig bond: Not to be on the premises of Shopko in Plover or Stevens Point.

Defendant Connie J Johnson in court with attorney Edmund Jelinski. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Atty Jelinski states his client is waiving a preliminary hearing today.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 11:00 am.
